com.communote.server.core.mail.messages

Class MailMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.mail.messages.MailMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.mail.javamail.MimeMessagePreparator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActivateUserForManagerMailMessage, ActivateUserMailMessage, BlogNameIdMissingInSubjectMailMessage, BlogsNotFoundMailMessage, ContentProcessingErrorMailMessage, DirectMessageMissingRecipientMailMessage, GenericErrorMailMessage, GenericMailMessage, ManagerSecurityWarnMailMessage, NewUserConfirmedForManagerMessage, NoteLimitReachedMailMessage, NotifyAboutCRCSizeLimitReachedMailMessage, NotifyAboutNoteMailMessage, NotifyUserCountLimitReachedMailMessage, NoWriteAccessToBlogMailMessage, RemindUserLoginMailMessage, SecurityCodeMailMessage, TextMailMessage, UserNotInClientMailMessage, WarningMailMessage

    public abstract class MailMessage
extends Object
implements org.springframework.mail.javamail.MimeMessagePreparator
    An abstract base class for all mail messages
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Constructor Detail

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage(String messageKey,
                   Locale locale,
                   User... receivers)
        Construct a new message with the given message key and locale.
        Parameters:
        messageKey - Key of the message template.
        locale - the locale to use
        receivers - A list of receivers for this message.

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage(String messageKey,
                   Map<String,String> templatePlaceholderMessageKeys,
                   Locale locale,
                   User... receivers)
        Construct a new message with the given message key and locale.
        Parameters:
        messageKey - Key of the message template.
        templatePlaceholderMessageKeys - A mapping of placeholders to message keys, which will be replaced within the template with the loaded message. Use it in the template @@placeholder@@.
        locale - the locale to use
        receivers - A list of receivers for this message.

    • Method Detail

      • addReceiver

        protected void addReceiver(org.springframework.mail.javamail.MimeMessageHelper message,
                           String email,
                           User receiver)
                    throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                           UnsupportedEncodingException
        Add a receiver by setting also the personal saluation if availablke.
        Parameters:
        message - the mime message
        email - the email of the receiver
        receiver - the receivers addtional information (hint: email is NOT used for sending)
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error
        UnsupportedEncodingException - in case of an error

      • getFromAddress

        public String getFromAddress()
        Gets the email address of the sender.
        Default implementation returns a value defined within a configuration file.
        One should be careful when overriding this method because the domain part of the address should normally not leave the domain of the outgoing email server.
        Returns:
        the email address

      • getFromAddressName

        public String getFromAddressName()
        Gets the from sender name.
        Returns:
        the sender name

      • getGlobalModel

        public Map<String,Object> getGlobalModel()
        get data that should be accessible for every mail message
        Returns:
        the model

      • getLocale

        public Locale getLocale()
        Returns:
        the locale

      • getMessageIdentifier

        protected String getMessageIdentifier()
        Returns an identifier of the message which can be used in the Message-ID header. The identifier must be unique and must fulfill the dot-atom-text pattern of rfc2822. The identifier will extended to become a syntactically correct Message-ID header field value.
        Returns:
        the message identifier or null if no specific Message-ID header should be set

      • getReplyToAddress

        public String getReplyToAddress()
        Returns a string holding the email address to be used in the "reply-to" header. The default implementation returns an address defined for the current client. If null is returned, the "reply-to" header will not be set.
        Returns:
        the email address

      • getReplyToAddressName

        public String getReplyToAddressName()
        Returns the personal name to be used in the "reply-to" header field.
        Returns:
        the personal name

      • isHtmlMail

        protected boolean isHtmlMail()
        States if the underlying mail template is an html mail or not.
        Returns:
        True if the mail template is an html email

      • prepare

        public void prepare(javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage mimeMessage)
             throws Exception
        Specified by:
        prepare in interface org.springframework.mail.javamail.MimeMessagePreparator
        Throws:
        Exception

      • prepareModel

        protected abstract void prepareModel(Map<String,Object> model)
        Use this to set the needed objects for applying the template. If restrict the map to a size add +1 for the message to be added.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to add elements to.

        Set the receivers for this message.
        Parameters:
